strings.Value: "Dugath sent us."
"The Defaced Sister sent us."
"We're just travelers."
[Finish off the barbarian] "Whatever."
[Leave without a word]
"Who are you?"
"What happened here?"
"I'll heal you."
[Finish off the barbarian] "I'll put an end to you."
[Heal the barbarian] "It's not yet your time."
[Finish off the barbarian] "As you wish. Gorum take your soul."
"I have to go."
[Say nothing]
"Shut up, Regongar! For once in your life, can you just keep your stupid jokes to yourself?"
"Right, ha ha! Better grow eyes in the back of your head! And sleep with one eye open!"
"Reg, that's not funny. A person is dying here. Now's not the time."
"Many good warriors found their way to Gorum today. Don't weep for them — they're already drinking mead in Elysium!"

{n}A barbarian sits leaning against the wall, surrounded by dead bodies. He seems to be barely alive. His entire face is a bloody wound, tattered scraps of skin dangling from it. As he hears your footsteps, he blindly turns toward the sound and raises his sword with immense effort.{/n} "Friend or foe?"
{n}The blind barbarian grips his sword with bloody hands.{/n} "You again?"

"Dugath! Of course, the old man would never leave anyone behind... But it's too late now. Only one left to save is me, and you may as well not bother. I'll be joining the rest of the dead soon enough."
"That witch! Look, I don't know who you are, but you can't trust her! We made that mistake, and look what happened!"

"If you're looking for a place to camp for the night, you may want to keep moving. Not a very cozy place here, as you can see!" {n}The barbarian tries to force a chuckle, but it comes out closer to a sob.{/n}
"Wait! Damn... I must be delirious. Gonna die here alone, talking to stone walls and corpses..."

"That cursed witch brought us here — blabbered on and on about some exalted mission, promised us cyclops treasures... Well, look what we got! Soon as we entered, dead cyclopes attacked us! Then there was a flash of light, and everything went insane..."

"It was like a red-hot nail was driven into my brain. Had an irresistible urge to kill, didn't matter who. I resisted it — barely — but most of us weren't so lucky... It was a slaughter, a nightmare where it was impossible to tell friend from foe!"

"We tried to retreat, but they followed. One grabbed my head and squeezed... Almost cracked me open like a walnut! My eyes... Last thing I saw was his fingers... If Varha hadn't chopped off his hand and dragged me out of there, I'd be dead already. She slammed the door right on their noses! Oh, Varha... Haven't heard from her for a while... Probably dead, now. Nice treasure-hunting trip we had, huh?"
"I'm Brag, son of Verig and Dyll, of the {g|Tiger Lords}Tiger Lords{/g} tribe. Came from {g|Numeria}Numeria{/g}. If you meet my people, tell them where and how I died."
"Don't bother. Who needs a blind cripple? Best to finish me — at least I'll die like a fighter, sword in hand... ready to meet {g|Gorum}Gorum{/g}..."
"{g|Gorum}Gorum{/g}... I'm coming..." {n}The whisper leaves the barbarian's stiffening lips as he clings to his blade with the last of his strength.{/n}
"Farewell... If you meet the {g|Tiger Lords}Tiger Lords{/g}, tell them what happened to us..."
"Gorum bless you."
"But you're still alive! Don't stop fighting!"
"Brave in battle, humble in the face of oblivion... You are a true warrior."
"What are you babbling about? I'm going to Elysium, to feast at {g|Gorum}Gorum's{/g} table with the greatest warriors of all time!"
{n}Harrim sighs and shakes his head.{/n}
"It's too late to fight. I can feel the life leaving my body with each breath..."
"So many good warriors left to meet {g|Gorum}Gorum{/g} before their time — all thanks to that witch! When I get my hands on her..."
"You'll manage! I know you will!" {n}Octavia smiles at you gratefully.{/n}
"That's right, with all these cyclopes around... you really have to keep your eyes peeled, ha ha!"
"Yes. Right... I'm sorry. I got carried away."
"Not a problem." {n}The barbarian bares his broken teeth in a morbid, bloody smirk.{/n} "Joke all you want — I won't bat an eye!"
"Fine, fine... What was that all about...?"
{n}Realizing no one is going to pay attention to his joke, Regongar begins examining the stone walls with exaggerated indifference.{/n}
"Right! Or they'll hit you in the blink of an eye! Boom! Bull's-eye!"
"Ha ha ha, you're quite the jokesters, aren't you?" {n}The barbarian bares his teeth in a morbid, bloody smirk.{/n} "You should go see them for yourselves — they're a real eye-popper!"
"Dead meat. Nok-Nok bored now. Let's go."
"You speak truth. But still, it's a pity. So many battles left unfought — so many songs unsung!"
"I wouldn't want to be in his place..." {n}Kalikke speaks so softly, you can barely make out her words.{/n} "To lose the chance to see the world in all its beauty... no, I'd rather die."
"Went into an ancient dungeon for some easy pickings, and found monsters there. What a surprise!"

{n}The barbarian's wounds close and his bleeding stops, but he remains blind — it will take much more powerful magic to restore his eyesight. He exhales with relief.{/n} "Thank you. I'm not sure how to live on, what I'll do, but... I'll figure something out."
